ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: ADD=c] 
      
Specifies a constant, c, to add to each value after standardizing and multiplying by the value you 
specify in the MULT= option. The default value is 0.

[Syntax: DATA=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies the input data set to be standardized. If you omit the DATA= option, the most recently 
created data set is used.

[Syntax: FUZZ=c] 
      
Specifies the relative fuzz factor. The default value is 1E–14.
Specifies the method for computing initial estimates for the A estimates (ABW, AWAVE, and AHUBER).

Specifies that output variables inherit the length of the analysis variable that PROC STDIZE uses 
to derive them.
Specifies the name of the method for computing location and scale measures.

[Syntax: MISSING=method | value] 
      
Specifies the method (or a numeric value) for replacing missing values. If you omit the MISSING= 
option, the REPLACE option replaces missing values with the location measure given by the METHOD= 
option.

[Syntax: MULT=c] 
      
Specifies a constant, c, by which to multiply each value after standardizing. The default value is 1.

[Syntax: NMARKERS=n] 
      
Specifies the number of markers used when you specify the one-pass algorithm (PCTLMTD=ONEPASS). 
The value n must be greater than or equal to 5. The default value is 105.

Omits observations with missing values for any of the analyzed variables from calculation of the 
location and scale measures.

Normalizes the scale estimator to be consistent for the standard deviation of a normal distribution 
when you specify the option METHOD=AGK, METHOD=IQR, METHOD=MAD, or METHOD=SPACING.

[Syntax: OUT=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies the name of the SAS data set created by PROC STDIZE.

[Syntax: OUTSTAT=SAS-data-set] 
      
Specifies the name of the SAS data set containing the location and scale measures and other 
computed statistics.

[Syntax: PCTLDEF=percentiles] 
      
Specifies which of five definitions is used to calculate percentiles when you specify the option 
PCTLMTD=ORD_STAT. By default, PCTLDEF=5.
Specifies the method used to estimate percentiles.

ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip1: Computes the percentiles by the order statistics method.
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip2: Modifies the P-square algorithm for histograms nvented by Jain and Chlamtac (1985).
ProcedureOptionToolTips.@ToolTip3: P-square algorithm for histograms proposed by Jain and Chlamtac (1985).

ProcedureOptionHelp.#cdata:
[Syntax: PCTLPTS=n] 
      
Writes percentiles to the OUTSTAT= data set. Values of n can be any decimal number between 0 and 100, inclusive.
Displays the location and scale measures.

Replaces missing data with the value 0 in the standardized data (this value corresponds to the 
location measure before standardizing).
Replaces missing data only; PROC STDIZE does not standardize the data.

Normalizes the scale estimator to have an expectation of approximately 1 for a standard normal 
distribution when you specify the METHOD=SPACING option.
Unstandardizes variables when you specify the METHOD=IN(ds) option.
Specifies the divisor to be used in the calculation of variances. By default, VARDEF=DF.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: BY <DESCENDING> variable-1 <...<DESCENDING> variable-n> <NOTSORTED>; 
      
Obtains separate analyses on observations in groups defined by the BY variables.

StatementOptionHelp.#cdata:
Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately 
follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.
Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

StatementHelp.#cdata:
Syntax: FREQ variable ;
      
If one variable in the input data set represents the frequency of occurrence for other values in 
the observation, specify the variable name in a FREQ statement. PROC STDIZE treats the data set as 
if each observation appeared n times, where n is the value of the FREQ variable for the observation.
